divs: Sighting DetailsI saw a white object that might have been a star in pure daylight. Object might have been a very high altitude balloon but without the tear-drop shape. Stationary. No movement at all. (Could be a very bright star?) It's still there as I write this--about a third from the zenith facing west. I was watering the lawn and happened to look up (at about 8:45 a.m. Thursday morning). The sky was clear, no clouds. I saw a white object (not really shining at all) and it was just hanging there. About a week ago a NASA balloon passed over the region and I thought it was one of those again, but this was without the tear-drop shape--thus I wasn't all that excited. But through the binoculars it didn't reveal much more of a shape than a round object. It's still there as I write this.
trends: There have been 417 other sightings in Phoenix
There were 2 other sightings in Phoenix on or around May 28th 2009
Summary: White round object (balloon?) over Phoenix very high.
